intro: Tetrapterys acuminata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed acacia, is a shrub native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its compound leaves, which are typically pinnate with 4–6 pairs of leaflets. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in racemose inflorescences, followed by elongated, woody pods containing flat, kidney-shaped seeds. Tetrapterys acuminata thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
